originalText: fo_nicolas
Start Element
nicolas
Guards! Guards! There's an intruder here! Guards!

::You come up to Nicolas only to see him greatly displeased.::

Apparently, Olivia is in prison because she was plotting my murder. Yes. Someone just told me. Isn't it a coincidence how all that happened right after you and I made a deal?
::Nicolas is standing pretty close to the fence overlooking a pool of molten metal.::
You mucked up, idiot! You get nothing. Idiot. I'm gonna be in muck up to here, and if you linger you'll be too. Get lost!

::Nicolas tries to conceal how pleased he is with your work, but his smile keeps growing wider and wider.:: 

Golden. You did good, and here's your money. You don't know me; I don't know you.
Listen, I'll be brief: You told me you could... take care of my problem for me? Is that true?
Leave me alone!
Yes? ::hic.::

::An obviously drunk man staggers about the room. He picks up one of the bottles on the table and begins drinking from it only to realize it is completely empty. His face deforms in utter disgust as he returns the bottle and steps away from the table. That is when he spots you.::

Who are you, and what are you doing in my house, huh, you? Err... did you knock? ::hic.::
Did you knock now, huh?
I'm very busy. Can't talk now.
Pst, you! I'd like to talk to you for a second. Can you meet me in the back?
Yes? Changed your mind?
::Nicolas completely ignores you.::
fo_prison
context.npc_fo_nicolas_talkedReport
I don't know what you're talking about.
::Push him over the fence.::
::The worker nearby could see you push Nicolas. You cannot do it while he's around.::
::Leave him alone.::
fo_tillDeathDoUsPartNicolas
::He hands you 800 charons.::
::He hands you 700 charons.::
fo_tillDeathDoUsPartNicolas
Yes.
::Follow him.::
I have to go.
context.npc_fo_nicolas_talkedReport
Get lost. You mucked this up all the way. Don't speak to me again, idiot. Get lost.
nicolas_patrol3
Fo_PushNicolas
::After handing you the charons, he nods and turns away from you.::
fo4
global:fo_nicolas:corner

Yes, that's correct. I'm not a violent man. Never was. But that woman... that *woman*.

I got a plan, and I want you to listen to me carefully. There is a certain way you must kill her or else the deal is off and you won't get any money.
I see. Goodbye, then.
What can you tell me about Foundry?
Do you know anything about the mine creatures?
How do you feel now that the mine has been reopened?
Well dang, I heard nothing. I'm so sorry. ::hic:: But where are my manners? Would you like a drink?

Well, you should knock you know! It's very rude to... pfffft... enter someone's house like that. ::hic:: I should just throw you out. ::He grabs his head with both arms.:: Ooh, my head hurts when I get angry! Oooh... Go back outside and knock if you want me to let you in. ::hic::
See, that's more like it... ::hic:: even though I heard nothing, which is strange... pffft. Ah, anyway, where are my manners? Would you like a drink? Hm?
Well, go back outside and knock, you dimwit!
Busy? Alright... but talk to me as soon as you can. Got it?
Great, follow me.
It's none of your business, you, you odd person that refuses free drinks! Demon. ::hic:: Why would I tell *anything* to you?
Well, from my current perspective, it's all a bit hazy and shaky. ::hic.::

I have no idea what you're talking about, you. What creatures? ::hic.:: You need to, uh, yeah. Creatures, you say? Aaaah, you mean Messer's pigs? Silly odd $(#man/woman), those are pigs, not creatures. I mean... ugh... pfffft.
It was closed? ::hic::
Bye, you!
It's a deal. I'll do it.
How much money are we talking about?
::[Mercantile]:: Seven hundred isn't good enough; eight, on the other hand, will give me less incentive to report you.
Where can I find her?
How do you want her to die?
There's something else you're not telling me. Why is it so important to make it look like a work accident when you can have her killed in so many different ways and not get caught?
I'm not doing it. Goodbye.
Well, I have a relative who sat home and drowned his problems with booze. He was found dead in a pool of his own vomit. So, if there's something you wanna talk about...
I could be hazy due to foul air. It hazes up... pfffft... things.

Ah, *mine* creatures. I get it now. But I don't have any pigs, no. Messer's got pigs. He-he. Sounds like he's got herpes or something. Messer's got pigs, he-he. HE-HE! He's got creatures! ::He bursts out laughing.::

I'm feeling hungry now. ::hic.::
Muck damn! Tough.

You don't want any? Well, that's a shame - and a bit odd if you ask me. $(#He/She) doesn't want a free drink, he-he. Silly. More for me, though. ::He pours himself another drink after finally finding a bottle with some liquor in it..:: 

I'm Nicolas, by the way. Nice to meet you, you.
Golden. That is all. We won't talk until the job's done.
Seven hundred stygian coins, only if you can make it look like it's a work-related accident.
Alright, alright. Eight hundred it is. We have a deal.
What? Look, it's seven hundred and not a single charon more.
She works as a chemist near the explosives warehouse; in fact, she is the one that mixes up the TNT miners use.

You have to make her death look like a work-related accident. Exactly how you do it is your choice, but you have to make sure no one can suspect she was murdered. No poisons, weapons or anything, you get it?
That's none of your business. Just do what I told you.
I don't wanna vomit in my die... pffft... die in my vomit.
Yeah?
currency\stygiancoin
Otherwise, you get nothing.
Just do the damn job and releive me of this misery. A hundred charons more is worth it.
And that's final. Got it?
The warehouse is near the mine entrance, can't miss it.
Remember: *Work*-*related* *accident.* Or else you get nothing.
::[Intimidate]:: Well, it is my business since I'll be doing the dirty work. Now, answer my question unless you want me to report you.

Listen, I'm having some personal... issues. ::He takes another gulp of the booze.:: It's my wife, Olivia. After twenty years of being happily married, it's like someone spilled molten metal all over our marriage. We, pffft... at first we began arguing more and more and... later it got worse and worse. Now we argue over everything. ::hic:: It's unbearable now. We fight all the time and... she throws stuff at me... and I punched that stupid woman once so hard she fell on the floor. Yeah! Upffff...
Sooooo, what can I do for you? ::hic::
fo_tillDeathDoUsPartNicolas
Take it easy, $(#man/woman). Someone is gonna hear you, damn it.
You don't scare me! I repeat, it's none of your business. You just do your part and you'll get your money.
I'm sure of that.

Look, Foundry is a very dangerous place to work in, obviously, and a few years ago people were becoming more and more reluctant to work here, despite the good, great pay. Therefore, the mayor offered... a sort of an insurance policy, like the thing from old world societies, if you've ever read about it. In short, if one of your family members dies at work, you get the insurance money. Get it?
Got it?
It is! It's very bad. I hate that woman so much now... and I don't even really know why it all started happening. ::hic:: What did you say your name was, again?
I have no idea... I really don't. But, I hate that woman so much now... and I don't even really know why it all started happening. ::hic:: What did you say your name was, again?
And while I'm getting rid of that witch, I might as well earn some money. And pay you for your work. Everyone's golden.

So, you, there you go. ::hic:: I feel nothing but pure hate for that muck-woman. ::He seems lost in thought, but after a couple of moments he starts talking again.:: It is unbearable. So much I even plan on killing her! ::As soon as he utters those words, his eyes instantly become clear and focused, as if he has sobered up in an instant. Tiny drops of sweat start rolling down his face, slowly growing larger and larger.::
Why didn't you say so right away. I can take care of her for you. For a price, of course.
This conversation is over! ::hic:: I'm very tired. Out! ::He points to the door.:: Out, I said!
